items.title: Spanx billionaire founder kept the brand a secret—even from family—for a year. If she hadn’t, she says she’d probably still be selling fax machines
items.description: Spanx’s billionaire founder turned $5,000 in savings from selling fax machines into a $1.2 billion shapewear empire.

items.title: New Opendoor Chairman Keith Rabois says he doesn’t know why the company has 1,400 employees: ‘We don’t need more than 200’
items.description: Rabois said he also wants to bring employees back to the office.

items.title: 65-year-old retirees in France now have higher incomes than working-age adults—meanwhile, American boomers can’t even afford to retire
items.description: While the French are enjoying higher wages in retirement than the country’s workers, nearly a fifth of American retirees are “struggling” or “living t...

items.title: Why OpenAI’s $300 billion deal with Oracle has set the ‘AI bubble’ alarm bells ringing
items.description: Oracle’s $300B deal with OpenAI drove a stock surge, but investors worry both companies could fail to deliver

items.title: Robert Redford, the Sundance Kid turned Sundance mogul, entrepreneur and independent film champion, dies at 89
items.description: He bought two acres in Provo Canyon, Utah, after falling in love with the area on a 1961 motorcycle trip. It was the start of something big.
